runs.comm: full in middle, worked down to mid-on
tucked neatly through midwicket, just touched that with a turn of his wrists and it sped across the outfield
angled into the pads, a strangled appeal from Finn and the slips but it's going well down the leg side
first slog of the match as Charles steps to leg and aims to swing a good length ball through the leg side and doesn't make contact
ooh, that's a good nut...short of a length and seams away from Charles as it climbs past the outside edge...Kieswetter takes at chest-height with the ball still rising
first boundary and it comes off a top edge as Charles tries to work it through the leg side and is completely beaten by pace and bounce...flies over the slip to third man
starts with a bounce to Gayle, it's pitched around leg stump and Gayle opts to duck under the line...a little sighter
back of a length on off stump, pushed back towards the bowler
short of a length, whipped through midwicket with a powerful flick and it races past midwicket
down the leg side, takes the pad which means it doesn't have much pace on it and Finn gets around the boundary
slower ball, dragged down short, sits up nicely for Gayle who waits a fraction longer and pulls it through square leg...he's off
what a shot, Dernbach responded with a very full ball on off stump, Gayle just stands there and punches it straight down the ground past mid-off
back of a length, nips into the right hander and Charles punches to cover
beaten! Another good one from Finn which moves away a fraction from Charles who is poking at it without much footwork
goes for the pull, doesn't get bat on it and takes the top of the pad down to third man
short of a length, at the body from Finn, Gayle defends it square into the off side to backward point
backs away to leg against another short ball and carves it over the off side...he knew what was coming and didn't make any attempt to keep the shot down
a rare shot he doesn' time as he splice this pull straight back past the bowler and it lobs towards mid-off...but it means he keeps the strike
comes at the bowler, it's short of a length and skews off a thick outside edge over short third-man
a stand-deliver-drive to a full delivery on the stumps, mid-off can't field it cleanly and parries it away for a single. Maybe tactical from England?

low full toss outside off, nicely turned away through backward point and Bairstow races around the boundary then dives full length to try and flick it back which he can't quite do as he touches the rope at the same time. Top effort, though
short of a length again, Charles pulls in front of square
shorter this time and rises over Charles' top edge as he tries to send it over midwicket
beaten by a back-of-a-length ball as he attempts to guide down to third man
persisting back of a length and this beats Gayle's attempt at an upper-cut...Kieswetter has to leap to make the take
starts to give himself room to the leg side, Finn followed him and speared the ball in fall at the feet which is worked to midwicket...Finn kicked the stumps, but no dead-ball yet
now Charles move to leg, less convincingly, and clubs towards mid-on without much timing
nice timing and placement as he opens the face and sends it square between point and cover
misses another off-side shot, losing his shape as he tries to hit too hard and doesn't connect
good finish to the cover from Finn, cramping Charles for room and he can only push it into the off side...two different games going on at the moment
good yorker, even Gayle can't get that away as he digs it out back to Broad
effortless...Broad just misses the yorker this time and gives Gayle the chance to get under the ball which he flicks over midwicket
threatens to come down the pitch, Broad bowls it shorter, Gayle cuts and gets a bottom edge into the ground towards the keeper
shorter ball on leg stump, Gayle is a touch early on the pull and gets taken on the arm as he swings through...gets a leg-bye into the off side
huge appeal for lbw, Charles was a long way across his stumps but Steve Davis says not out...blimey, that looked closed. Might have got away with that.
short of a length, heaved through midwicket to man on the boundary
round the wicket and big spin outside off stump, Gayle pulls his bat out of the line at the last moment...interesting
this one holds its line, Gayle pushes into the off side
comes forward, takes an inside edge to one that doesn't turn and it runs out to deep square-leg
beaten outside off trying to open the face
down the pitch, clubs it through the leg side and although it doesn't come out of the middle he splits the gap between long-on and deep midwicket
swinging to leg again, this time it goes squarer to the man at deep square
round the wicket, pushed to the off side
dragged down short, turns and it means Charles drags his pull through mid-on
dropped in short, Gayle pulls high but not quite with his usual distance but it has enough to creep over the boundary at deep midwicket
short outside off, cracked to the man at cover
that's bigger...picked up from leg stump and a powerful slog-sweep which goes way back into the stands at deep square
quicker and flatter but it makes no difference, Gayle has launched this almost over the grass banks as he just stands in his crease and swings through the line
turns into Charles who drives off the back foot to deep cover
opens the face and guides it to short third-man but they still scamper a single
poor delivery, pushed outside leg stump and that's almost a free hit as Charles sweeps it backward of square
now Charles gets into the six-hitting fun as he crunches this over long-on
tries to work this to leg, gets an inside edge into his pad
another one clears the boundary...he uses his feet then flicks it high over midwicket with plenty of legs to carry the rope
beats Gayle first ball and an appeal for an inside edge but nothing given...Gayle gave himself a little room and was a touch late on his shot
on off stump, worked along the ground through midwicket
steps to leg, opens the face and guides a ball outside off to third man
full on leg stump, aims to turn to the leg side and gets a leading edge but along the ground through mid-off...that's fifty for Gayle from 29 balls. Fantastic innings.
low full toss outside off, driven square through the off side
flicked through the leg side to deep midwicket
round the wicket, tossed up outside off, pushed away on the front foot
slide through on a length and tapped towards point - another dot
crunched! It couldn't last, Gayle leans back and booms a huge extra-cover drive into the stands
length ball, spinning away, Gayle swipes and toe-ends a single down the ground
dropped, Swann fumes as Finn lets a skier through his hands at long-off! England's shocker gets shocking-er

BUT HE CATCHES THIS ONE! Gayle goes, slogging Swann high to the same part of the ground, Finn was the man under it again and he made amends for his drop one delivery earlier by clutching the ball to his chest at long-on and sending the Windies marauder on his way
length ball on the stumps, turned to midwicket
bit of width outside off, opens the face and steers a single to third man
pitched up on the stumps, Charles backs away and absolutely leathers the ball low through extra-cover for four
slower ball this time, sliding past leg stump and Charles goes down on one knee and misses with an attempted paddle
full and straight and bunged back down the ground for four more, it was a bump ball, looped over Wright and then skidded on
slings this wide of the guidelines outside off
full and wide, swipes the ball along the ground out towards long-on
tossed up outside off, swept to short fine leg - that brings up a calculated fifty from Charles
length ball, straightening outside off, steered to short third man
pushed back down the ground for one
drags this a touch shorter, Charles advances and taps through the covers
tossed up outside off, makes room to cut but misses out
floated up on the stumps, lofts down the ground but it won't beat long-off coming across and they pick up a couple
back of a length and wide of the stumps, Samuels has a wild swing and a miss
short ball again, at the man, hooks but doesn't get a clean connection and midwicket fields
banged in, short and quick, fizzes through at shoulder height as Samuels against fails to connect
and gone! Samuels made room, the ball was short of a length but not a bouncer, and he slapped it uppishly straight to the fielder at backward point. A brief, ugly innings from Samuels ends tamely
wide of the stumps, touch short and beats the outside edge as Pollard drifts across his crease
another dot, banged in short and just outside the line of off, Pollard blinks and drops his hands - wicket maiden from Broad
pushed through on the stumps, gets a bottom edge playing with a horizontal bat for one to short fine leg
tossed up and pushed into the off side on the front foot
reaches for the big slog and this squirts high into the air on the off side, landing between two fielders in the covers
length ball tossed up outside off, slaps this through the covers for a couple
pushed through a bit quicker, Charles swings across the line but fails to connect
BOOM! That's gone all the way, skips out and plants and huge, 95-metre six over long-on to ruin what was looking a respectable over from Patel

and it works, Pollard unable to control a wild slash at Finn, the ball coming back down with snow on it as Wright takes the catch at deep point! Little foot movement from Pollard, he just stood in the crease and tried to smash a length ball, got a huge top edge and not enough distance to save him
length ball, on the stumps, steps back and skewers and low drive through backward point
this time he goes the other side, shifting across the stumps to whip a length delivery through backward square leg, using the pace on the ball to get four more
pitched up, squeezed out through backward point again, it bounces in front of Bairstow on the boundary who jumps and pops it safely back into play before fielding
full and wide and speared straight to point - dot ball
pitched up outside off, frees the arms and drives low through the covers to the man on the rope
floated up on leg stump, skids on and hits the pad, rolling for a leg bye
flatter, sees Charles coming, he flat-bats one on the bounce to deep midwicket
pushed through on off stump, slaps a single through point
steps away to leg, Patel follows him and Charles works it through midwicket
tossed up, spinning away outside off, manages to get some bat on it behind point
pushed through outside off, turns through the leg side for one more
length ball, on the stumps, flipped over square leg and that's actually a terrific shot, as it spins away and races to the rope
full and wide, gets across and tries to flick to leg but fails to connect
pitched and and right in the slot, Charles launches this high towards wide long-on and it's a one-bounce four
good reply from Dernbach, yorker length and Charles can't get it off the cut strip

low full toss, lofted to mid-on and gone! It seemed like Charles just didn't have the energy for that shot, the arms didn't flow through and it looped gently to Bairstow running in - chance of a rare T20I ton disappears but that's a cracking knock after a slow start
length outside off, Bravo stands and delivers a swing and a miss
back of a length, miscued pull shot goes down the ground between long-on and long-off for a couple
dug in, Sammy swings across to line and gets a leading edge just over the outstretched arm of mid-off, long-on comes round but they get back for a second

bowled him, out the back of the hand and Sammy is gone! He was aiming to milk Broad for a maximum over cow corner but was well through the shot by the time the slower ball pitched and skidded on to the stumps
banged in very short, steepling and flying through as Russell flails at it unsuccessfully
well, not sure how he's got the ball there, it was short again, Russell threw the bat at it and top-edged a high, looping four to long leg
length ball outside off, steps away and slices over point, lands short of the rope and Finn gets round to field on his knees and prevent four
full length, steps away and slugs one down the ground to long-off
full and straight, not quite yorker length and Russell mows across the line like a murderous gardener, thick edging four in completely the opposite direction to third man
dug in short this time, swings and misses and is hit on the shoulder, the ball rebounding just past the stumps
slower ball, on leg stump and Bravo spots it, clears the front foot and creams it down the ground for four to long-on
full and outside the line of off and smeared over extra-cover, meaty connection and that gallops away into the gap
full and wide, too wide for Bravo to connect with and it goes through to Kieswetter, they scamper a bye anyway
